main_definition: Thumbnails refer to small, low-resolution images that represent larger versions of the content or are used in various contexts such as digital media, film industry, and information organization.

meanings_and_examples.example: When browsing a photo gallery online, each image is displayed with its thumbnail next to it. These small images are easy to view on screen without needing to zoom in.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Representations of larger content or media
meanings_and_examples.example: A film director provides several thumbnails during a pitch meeting, each representing different scenes from the movie script.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Preview images used in various software and applications
meanings_and_examples.example: In video editing programs, you can preview your work by viewing a series of thumbnails for each clip or frame within a project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collection of small, representative images compiled into an album
meanings_and_examples.example: An artist creates an album showcasing their latest artwork. The album includes high-quality thumbnails that give viewers an idea of the style and subject matter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collection of small, animated images used in storytelling or illustrations
meanings_and_examples.example: An author writes a children's book with several panels. Each panel is accompanied by a thumbnail that illustrates part of the scene depicted.
